content.text: Plants are a rich source of nutrients for many organisms, including bacteria, fungi and viruses. Although plants lack an immune system that is comparable to animals, plants have evolved chemical barriers to stop invading pathogens from causing significant damage.

questions.prompt: Describe **two** chemical barriers that could be present in a plant that is protecting itself from an invading pathogen.
Humans have a sophisticated immune response to invading pathogens.\n\nState** two** ways that pathogens are prevented from entering the internal environment of the human body.
Outline how complement proteins and natural killer cells protect the human body once a pathogen has gained entry to the internal environment
